title: Can we fucking gut Jinx already?
body:
I dont normally use win-rates to make a point, but this is just fucking stupid.

http://na.op.gg/statistics/champion/

Today: Jinx has a massive 35% pick-rate. The highest out of everyone.  While also having a 53.76% winrate, the fifth highest.

This week: 53.54% win rate. Still the most picked champion.


She pushes faster than a god damn Jax, has an amazing early, mid and late, has global pressure, hard CC, poke that slows and also gives true sight. Her biggest issue is the lack of mobility, but this isnt so bad when she has a Leona sucking her dick all game long. 

Seriously, Fishbones gives better range than Caitlyn, AoE autos that can crit and an extra 10%, why does she need so much crap into one ability, when Pow Pow already provides 130% attack speed?

Her stats are arguably dumber than post-rework Ahri before she got nerfed.

I would rather face pre-nerf Lucian than this bitch. If she wins lane, she will win the game. If she lost, she will split push all game long. If she is behind and gets a lucky kill, she instantly becomes more powerful than your ADC.

Fuck this champion.

replies.body: How can Jinx be a threatening splitpusher when she's immobile and easily ganked?

> [{quoted}](name=BluePolarizer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HfZ7F8wF,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-02T18:31:17.680+0000)
>
> How can Jinx be a threatening splitpusher when she's immobile and easily ganked?

Because a good Jinx player who built a little damage and AS on her can shred towers and wave clear really fast.  I've been in one game where my team was getting rocked badly midgame.  We had me on Jinx and a Master Yi who whenever we had a breather would head out to split push.  (me usually bottom, him usually top).  Eventually we managed to take all 3 inhibitor turrets and that meant if I could get to their base I'd get at least 2 inhibitors before they could recall to stop me.  (admittedly the other team had horrible warding and map awareness which allowed me to get to their base without challenge again and again.)  In the end my team won because our constant taking out of the inhibitors prevented the other team from rushing us and we caught up on gold at about 55 minutes.

Jinx is immobile and most times will die quickly if you 2v1 her as she can't escape, but if the other team doesn't challenge her she can split push amazingly well thanks to her wave clear and ability to take down towers.  Her passive even helps because she gets the speed boost when the tower goes down which does allow her to escape if you recall and try to charge at her from the base.

A good splitpusher needs to take towers and minion waves fast, but most importantly, needs to be able to duel 1v1 and escape 2v1s. It has to be all of them.

That's why Udyr, Yi, Quinn, Jax, Sivir, RIven, Lucian and Trynd are such good splitpushers, but Akali, Fizz (either AD or AP), and yes, most ADCs, aren't good splitpushers. All of the above have MS steroids or wall jumps, high damage, AD/AS steroids and waveclear, whereas most ADCs are lacking in either mobility, taking towers, waveclear or dueling. 

Jinx is a poor duelist; she has unreliable CC, no mobility and unless way more fed than the opposition, gets owned by bruisers 1v1. She also can't escape very well.

I play alot of bruisers and carry junglers/tops, and whenever I see an immobile ADC splitpushing its just another free 300 gold.

All that needs to be done to keep Jinx in check is to bring back carry bruisers like Jax and burst ADCs like Lucian. If you can actually get in her face, she isnt that scary.

Jinx a poor duelist?  Jinx is probably the best pure duelist of all the ADCs if she uses her minigun and has built any attack speed.  With her Q to level 5 and using her minigun she has the highest attack speed in the game once it gets to 3 stacks, that's why she can crush turrets so well.  Yes, anyone with decent armor can probably survive long enough to kill her in a 1v1, but I've beaten quite a few good melee duelists mid and late game in a 1v1 if I have any life steal and don't let them get the first attack in. In fact if I am splitpushing and someone comes to 1v1 me, I'll stand and fight rather than run.  In that situation I win probably 60-70% of the duels.  I then try to run away from any follow up attacks.  It's the 2v1 attacks that crush most of my splitpush attempts on Jinx.

Passives that only work on-kill are really bad design. Do you really want to give ADC players MORE reason to scream at supports for taking kills?

I would normally comment on how Jinx's passive is poorly designed by default, as her main weakness SHOULD be her mobility, but yet you see it in her passive. I'm saying that in order to actually cement that flaw in her kit, she needs less of a window to activate it; AKA only on kill. 

The problem of the support taking the kill would only happen in the early game; later on, Jinx should have plenty of damage to actually kill things. It also gives her a reason to be more commonly paired up with tanky supports that have less damage than say, a Zyra or Sona support who could accidentally take the kill easier. The tanky supports will not only protect her, but lock down the enemy long enough for HER to get the kill instead so she can utilize her passive.

Jinx is popular because she can work with just about any support and despite her low mobility and base attack speed.  (she actually has the lowest base attack speed of all the ADCs at level 18)  But that doesn't mean she's perfect.

Vayne is far better late game than Jinx
Ashe has much better CC and can use her ult to initiate
Corki and Tristana have much better escapes
Corki and Graves have better burst
Kalista has far more mobility.
--
I could go on, but there is no reason to list all the ways other champs are better.

As for some of your other complaints.

Fishbones at level 5 has 700 range, equal to Caitlyn, but not better.  Also after the first 2 shots it goes of Jinx's low base attack speed, not the boosted level she gets for using Pow Pow.  That's her tradeoff.  Range and AOE effect but low attack speed.

splitpush.  Most good Jinx's don't splitpush just because they are behind.  There are only 2 good times to splitpush.  First, if you are trying to farm, which means the other team should be trying to stop Jinx anyways, as Jinx can/will eventually kill enough minions to catch up if you don't move to stop her.  Sure it means you don't push the other base as hard, but a team trying to team fight without an ADC is at a disadvantage.  So the other team should take advantage of it.  The second is if the team Jinx is on is behind, but can hold on in team fights 4v5.  Then Jinx is like a Nasus or Udyr in that her ability to shred towers can relieve pressure on their own base as the other team has to recall to deal with her.

But having Jinx away from the teamfight leaves her damage dealing capability out of the fight, which does her team no favors.  Even a weak Jinx can throw down an impressive amount of damage if she can single out a target and use PowPow's AS boost with her auto-attacks.  That's where she should be.  (and almost every double and triple kill I've gotten on her has involved using her minigun, not Fishbones - a few have involved perfectly timed ults)

But she isn't perfect.  I've had games where I've had the other team steamroll me and make sure that I never would get back on track.  A Jinx without much farm can't do much to help her team and is a liability at times as she's a slow and squishy target.  Teams that focus her early in teamfights can prevent her from getting back in the game and often use killing her as a entry into wiping out the other side in the teamfight.

---
TL,DR:  Learn a bit more about Jinx before you complain.  She's good, and popular because she's fun to play, but its not impossible to defeat her.  (I've done it enough times and lost while playing her as well.)

I agree that Jinx does possibly deserve a slight nerf (not sure where). The fact that her solo queue winrate is high *and* that she sees a lot of pro play indicates that she is indeed probably overpowered. However, I personally think she's a fun and well-designed champ, and I would be very sad to see Riot "gut" her. A small nerf just to keep her in line might be welcome.
